title: OnePlus 2 will soon be available without invites
text: OnePlus 2 will soon be available without invites TOI Tech | Sep 11, 2015, 05.32 PM IST Chairman Carl Pei said the company is considering hosting an open sale for an hour for OnePlus 2. It has not yet finalized when it be held -- either late September or early October. RELATED NEW DELHI: It has been over a month since OnePlus 2 became available for purchase, but the invite system has kept many a buy away from the handset. The company also realizes the issues buyers have been facing in getting their hands on the popular device, and chairman Carl Pei has issued an apology for the same. On the official OnePlus forum, Pei apologized for the delay, not only to the brand's fans but also to its partners and its own team. OnePlus 2 full specs More importantly, Pei wrote that the company has held discussions on how to make up for the delay in shipping. One of the ideas discussed by them is to hold an open sale where buyers will not require an invite to order a unit of OnePlus 2. But there's a catch. OnePlus 2 will be up for sale a pretty short time - just one hour. This window will likely be short to meet the pent up demand for the smartphone. This will be a global affair, so buyers in India may have to compete with millions of prospective buyers to get their hands on a unit. READ ALSO: OnePlus 2 review Pei said the company has not yet finalized when the event will be held, writing "We will need to look into production and operations to determine when this is most feasible." He added that it will likely hold the open sale either in late September or early October. -- OnePlus 2 features a 5.5-inch Full HD (1920x1080p) IPS LCD In-Cell display that the company says is brighter than that of last year's model. Below the display is hardware button that houses a fingerprint scanner and can save up to five fingerprints. The smartphone runs on OxygenOS, based on the latest Android version Lollipop 5.1. It is the first device to ship with OnePlus' own operating system out of the box. This dual-sim smartphone is powered by 64-bit Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 SoC, which is the fastest processor on the market right now. It sports a 13MP rear camera with a 1.3-micron sensor, laser autofocus, dual-LED flash, f/2.0 aperture, and Optical Image Stabilization system; on the front is a 5MP selfie camera. READ ALSO: OnePlus 2 vs Asus Zenfone 2: Which one to buy OnePlus 2 packs a 3,300mAh that is approximately 10% bigger than the 3,100mAh battery of the original model. On the connectivity front, it supports 4G, 3G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and A-GPS. Other than the company's classic Sandstone Black back cover, OnePlus 2 will also have option of StyleSwap covers namely, Bamboo, Black Apricot, Rosewood and Kevlar. It is the world's first smartphone with a reversible USB Type-C connector. The highlight of the USB Type-C cable is that it's backwards compatible, so users don't need to check which side of the connector is up while inserting it, much like with Apple's Lightning connector. The Type-C port on the OnePlus 2 could allow file transfer speeds of up to 10Gbps and allows the smartphone to charge faster. READ ALSO: 5 high-end features OnePlus 2 doesn't have However, this means standard USB accessories will not work with the smartphone. In order to fix this, OnePlus is also selling a USB Type C-to-microUSB adapter cable. The 64GB OnePlus 2 is available for purchase in India with an invite exclusively on Amazon at Rs 24,999. The 16GB OnePlus 2 with 3GB LPPDR4 RAM will be available later this year. OnePlus 2 vs OnePlus One: 10 new features of 11 OnePlus 2 is finally here, ending months of wait for the fans and speculation by the users. The new smartphone costs Rs 24,999, will be available starting August 11 and comes with several features that no other smartphone offers at this price point.But what about its predecessor, OnePlus One? Here we take a look at the 10 features OnePlus 2 has that OnePlus One does not… Unlike its predecessor, OnePlus 2 sports a hardware button below the screen that houses the integrated fingerprint scanner that can store up to 5 fingerprints. The company claims that its fingerprint sensor is faster than Apple’s TouchID scanner. Though OnePlus 2 has the same 5.5-inch display and Full HD (1080x1920p) resolution as its predecessor, the screen is brighter this time around, the company says.The smartphone uses in-cell display technology for better sunlight legibility, and has 178-degree viewing angles. In dark mode, the display will also get much dimmer, so that the screen can be viewed without straining the eyes. OnePlus 2 packs the top-end 64-bit octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 810 chipset with 4GB RAM under hood, which is the fastest processor in the market at present. On the other hand, last year’s OnePlus One is powered by the 2.5GHz quad-core Snapdragon 801 processor with 3GB RAM.OnePlus 2 has a 16GB storage variant also, which comes with Snapdragon 810 processor and 3GB RAM. OnePlus 2 holds the distinction of being the world’s first smartphone to sport the new USB Type C connector, which will be the standard with all Android smartphone when Google releases Android M. The Type-C port on the OnePlus 2 is backwards compatible like Apple’s Lightning adapter, can support file transfer speeds of up to 10Gbps and allows the smartphone to charge faster.However, it also means that standard microUSB accessories will not work with OnePlus 2; for that, the company is selling a reversible USB cable.OnePlus has introduced a new Alert Slider that allows you to turn the phone to silent mode with just a push, similar to what we have seen in iPhones.
